intro: Schkuhria virgata, commonly known as the white thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive basal rosette structure. Schkuhria virgata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
